intro: Brandesia alba, commonly known as the white brandesia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. The botanical features of Brandesia alba make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural collections.
